Jumbotron.Quote: Our project does more than raise money. It builds community around your work.

Text.Creators: It's very easy. Two main pillars of CO-OP - Rita Pyrkh & George Puisha. There were a lot of advisors, fans and etc., but the list is 2 long 2 handle.
Text.Technologies: Front-end - Angular 2+, back-end - Node.js+Express. Many libs such as passport.js, moment.js and others. Cloudinary for photo uploading, mLab as mongodb database.
Text.EasterEgg: Comrade front-end curator, if you have reached this page, then you are a really tough dude! Regards from CO-OP team.

Tags.Main: Ultimate ability to learn about everything!
Tags.Welcome: Welcome to CO-OP Guide! This page will walk you through everything from planning your shipping to communicating with backers.

Projects.Abstract: Your project can be anything that you want to create and share with others. It could be a book, a film, a piece of hardware... pretty much anything you dream up can find a home on CO-OP. Just keep your project focused, with a clearend goal, and you’ll be good

ListOne.Intro: Every CO-OP project should have the following:
ListOne.ItemOne: A project page with a cover and description that clearly explain the story behind your project
ListOne.ItemThree: News that share the creative journey as the project comes to life

Projects.Answer: If your project is simple and straightforward, then maybe your project page can be, too. If you’re doing something more complex, share details to demonstrate that you know what you’re doing. Either way, there are some basic questions you should answer:

ListTwo.TagOne: Introduce yourself, your team, and any similar work you’ve done
ListTwo.ItemTwo: What are you planning to make?
ListTwo.TagTwo: The more details, the better. Sketches, samples, prototypes — it all helps backers get as excited as you are.
ListTwo.ItemThree: What’s your plan, and what’s your schedule?
ListTwo.TagThree: Lay out a clear, specific timeline for what backers can expect.
ListTwo.TagFour: Tell people why you’re passionate about your project and committed to making it happen.

News.TextOne: Throughout your project, you’ll be communicating with backers and keeping them informed of your progress. Project updates, news posts, project chat will help you keep backers in the loop.
News.TextTwo: Think of these as your project’s blog. Keep backers engaged through interesting and shareable updates, and encourage them to spread the word about your progress, like this project did. Backers aren’t just looking for updates on when their rewards will show up — most of them love a look at the details of how work like yours is actually made. Show them!
News.TextThree: Backers appreciate regular, insightful, and honest updates. Don’t be hesitant to communicate delays or changes to your original plans — or to just check in. (If backers don’t hear from you for a while, they worry that you may be having trouble doing the work you promised.)

Headers.UpdateTag: Try to avoid errors in future!

Creation.Title: Project title

Creation.DescriptionTag: Description can help people to understand your purpose.
Creation.BodyTag: Tell people about yourself, about your goals and gifts.
